text: Praise for Salvation
Yahweh, you \add are\add* my God; I will exalt you.
I will praise your name,
for you have done wonderful things,\f + \fr 25:1 \ft Hebrew “thing” \f*
plans\f + \fr 25:1 \ft Hebrew “plan” \f* ⸤of old⸥,\f + \fr 25:1 \ft Literally “from far away “ \f* \add in\add* faithfulness, trustworthiness.
For you have ⸤made⸥\f + \fr 25:2 \ft Literally “placed” \f* \add the\add* city \add a\add* heap,
\add the\add* fortified city a ruin,
\add the\add* palace of foreigners ⸤is no longer⸥\f + \fr 25:2 \ft Literally “from” \f* a city;
it will ⸤never⸥\f + \fr 25:2 \ft Literally “to eternity not” \f* be rebuilt.
Therefore strong peoples will glorify you;
a city of ruthless nations, they will fear you.
For you have been a refuge to the poor,
a refuge to the needy in his distress,
a shelter from \add the\add* rainstorm,
a shade from \add the\add* heat.
For \add the\add* breath of \add the\add* ruthless \add was\add* like a rainstorm against a wall,\f + \fr 25:4 \ft The same consonants with different vowels can be translated “winter rainstorm” \f*
\add the\add* noise of foreigners like heat in a dry land.
You subdued \add the\add* heat with \add the\add* shade of a cloud;
\add the\add* song of \add the\add* ruthless was silenced.
And on this mountain Yahweh of hosts will make for all peoples a ⸤rich feast⸥,\f + \fr 25:6 \ft Literally “feast of fat” \f*
a feast of aged wines, fat filled with marrow, filtered aged wine.
And on this mountain he will ⸤destroy⸥\f + \fr 25:7 \ft Literally “engulf” \f* the face of the shroud,
the shroud over all peoples,
and the woven covering over all nations.
He will ⸤destroy⸥\f + \fr 25:8 \ft Literally “engulf” \f* death forever,
and the Lord Yahweh will wipe off \add the\add* tears from all faces,
and he will remove the disgrace of his people from all the earth,
for Yahweh has spoken.
And one will say, on that day,
“Look! This \add is\add* our God! We have waited for him and he saved us!
This \add is\add* Yahweh; we waited for him!
Let us be glad,
and let us rejoice in his salvation.”
For the hand of Yahweh will rest on this mountain,
and Moab shall be trampled down under him

as ⸤a heap of straw is trampled down⸥\f + \fr 25:10 \ft Literally “the trampling down of a heap of straw” \f* in ⸤waters of⸥\f + \fr 25:10 \ft These words are in the written Hebrew text, but not in the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* a dung heap.
And it\f + \fr 25:11 \ft Moab \f* will spread out its hands in the midst of it,
just as the swimmer spreads out to swim,
and its pride will be brought low with the movement\f + \fr 25:11 \ft Meaning uncertain \f* of its hands.
And he will throw down the fortification of the high point of your walls;
he will bring \add it\add* low;
he will ⸤send it⸥\f + \fr 25:12 \ft Literally “cause \fq it \ft to touch” \f* to the ground,
to \add the\add* dust.
